alert.note: Alert for Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Ascension, East Baton Rouge, East Feliciana, Livingston, St. Helena, Tangipahoa and West Baton Rouge. In southern Mississippi, Amite, Pike and Wilkinson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Mccomb, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Amite, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Livingston, Summit, Independence, Roseland and Albany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
